title: Enhancing Collective Efficacy in Online Collaborative Learning: Applying Multi-Agent Interaction Design

context.prior_knowledge: Experience using online collaboration tools and practical teaching experience in secondary language education
context.additional_context: Online collaborative competency enhancement course for in-service secondary language teachers, conducting real-time/asynchronous collaboration activities using mobile devices in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners complete three or more collaborative tasks in a multi-agent interaction environment, improving collective efficacy by 20% or more
Learners identify two or more interaction patterns in the collaboration process through network analysis
Learners achieve 80% or higher participation in the collective knowledge-building process during a collaborative language education material development project
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
